text: Actually I have a NES remix of Dancing Mad (the final boss fight from FF6) in my favourites list, they even replicate Kefka's laugh! It's in the same video as a NES remix of the FF4 final boss theme too, both sound great.
author: Babybahamut

text: I don't use it, but there's a free trial version (it disables saving, but I don't need to save for this). So yeah, the project file would work fine, and thanks in advance for this!
author: Azure Lazuline

text: Do you use FL Studio? That's what I used to make this song. I don't know how to make midis but I could send you the project file after replacing everything with stock instruments.
author: SupraDarky

text: Hey, do you think you (or someone else) could make a midi of this, or some other way that I can see the individual notes? If you can, I'll definitely make my own remix of this, since it sounds amazing. ^_^
author: Azure Lazuline

text: Dang, SupraDarky, I can't seem to stop listening to this!  It's got "final stage" written all over it.  Favorited!
author: Chris Chilcoat

text: Great work, SD!  This creates a great sense of atmosphere with some surprising and subtle variations within the musical patterns.  This would have made a killer Solar Jetman song -- and as much as I love that game's soundtrack -- this would have ended up as my favorite track.
author: Chris Chilcoat

text: It probably wouldn't be as good, but it would be interesting!
author: SupraDarky

text: I added an MP3 download link (newgrounds) in the description. Feel free to vote for it there if you like it too!
author: SupraDarky

text: Haha that would be pretty cool! *imagines an 8-bit version of FFVI*
author: SupraDarky

text: Not bad. Definately would fit in a GB, GBA, or flash game.
author: Sephiko

text: I got inspired by DKC's Fear Factory for this, I tried to make a factory chiptune. :P Watch the HQ version, some stereo sounds get muffled in standard!
